questions.question: What is the coefficient of static friction denoted by?
Which force opposes the motion between the surfaces in contact in the experiment?
What is the condition for work to be done on an object?

answers.b: There is no displacement of the object
answers.c: Force is applied to the object
answers.d: Force and displacement are in the same direction

questions.question: Which type of energy is possessed by an object by virtue of its motion?
What is the work done by conservative forces on a closed path?
What factor(s) determine whether an object kept on a tilted surface remains at rest or slides down the plane?

answers.c: Coefficient of friction between the surfaces in contact

questions.question: What is the formula for calculating kinetic energy?
Which type of energy depends only on the initial and final positions of the object along the path?
What is the primary source of error mentioned in the experiment?

answers.a: Determination of the angle of repose
answers.d: Recording the mass of the object

questions.question: When a block slides down an inclined plane, which of the following best represents the relationship between kinetic energy (K.E.) and potential energy (P.E.) with time?

answers.a: Both K.E. and P.E. increase with time
